data: Refractory status epilepticus is defined as failure to stop seizure after adequate doses of 2 anticonvulsants
Consider central line or intraosseous access if failed peripheral IV

To optimize seizure control and neuroprotection, benzodiazepine infusion is first-line, followed by ketamine, then valproic acid, then proPOFol, then pentobarbital
Concurrently, maintenance antiepileptic therapy should be started with phenytoin/phenobarbital, followed by levETIRAcetam then valproic acid
0.1 mg/kg, IV, q5min, PRN other (see comment), administer over: 2 min, drug form: inj
midazolam PED ICU titratable infusion (5 mg/mL)  6 kg and above in D5W
titrate, IV, 120 mcg/kg/h starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/h minimum rate , 900 mcg/kg/h maximum rate, titrate instructions: increase 120 mcg/kg/h q5min if seizure continues
midazolam PED ICU titratable infusion (1 mg/mL) below 6 kg in D5W
titrate, IV, 120 mcg/kg/h starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/h minimum rate , 900 mcg/kg/h maximum rate, titrate instructions: increase 120 mcg/kg/h q5in if seizure continues
Consider levETIRAcetam if not previously given in Status Epilepticus management
60 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj, first dose: STAT
2 mg/kg, IV, once, administer over: 1 min, drug form: inj, first dose: STAT
ketamine PED ICU titratable infusion (10 mg/mL) below 70 kg
titrate, IV, 10 mcg/kg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/min minimum rate, 60 mg/kg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: increase 10 mcg/kg/min q10min if seizure continues
If seizure ongoing, load with valproic acid. Use with caution in children less than 2 years. Valproic acid IV is a Special Access Program drug
20 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj, first dose: STAT
40 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj, first dose: STAT
If seizure ongoing, add proPOFol OR pentobarbitol. ProPOFol is contraindicated in ketogenic diet
1 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj, first dose: STAT
proPOFol PED ICU titratable infusion (10 mg/mL) 20 mL
titrate, IV, 100 mcg/kg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/min minimum rate, 300 mcg/kg/min, titrate instructions: per provider direction, order duration: 24 hour
proPOFol PED ICU titratable infusion (10 mg/mL) 100 mL
titrate, IV, 100 mcg/kg/min starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/min minimum rate, 300 mcg/kg/min, titrate instructions: per provider direction, order duration: 24 hour
If seizure ongoing, transition to pentobarbitol infusion. Pentobarbital is a Special Access drug
5 mg/kg, IV,once, drug form: inj, first dose: STAT
titrate, IV, 1 mg/kg/h starting rate, 0 mg/kg/h minimum rate, 5 mg/kg/h maximum rate, titrate instructions: per provider direction
Electrolytes Panel (Na, K, Cl, CO2, Anion Gap)
Blood, Timed Unit Collect, Collection: T;N, q4h interval for 24 hour
Blood, Timed Unit Collect, Collection: T;N, q4h interval for 24 hour
Blood, Timed Unit Collect, Collection: T;N, q4h interval for 24 hour
Liver Panel (Bilirubin Total, ALT, Alb, ALP, GGT)
Blood, Urgent, Unit Collect, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Urgent, Unit Collect, Collection: T;N, once
Blood, Timed, Unit Collect, Collection: T;N+180
Urgent, Reason for Exam: refractory status epilepticus, Schedule as: Inpatient, Schedulilng Locations: BCH EEG EMG, Portable
